description: Cladding Rectification Professional Services – hosted by Major Projects Canberra Register of SuppliersThe ACT Government is hosting a Register of Suppliers to assist private property owners who may have potentially combustible cladding to:testing and assessing whether the cladding on their building is combustibleproviding advice and guidance on the fire safety risk to residents as a result of the claddingadvising building owners on any remediation work required to reduce the risk to residents to an acceptable levelproviding a detailed cost estimate on the recommended remediation worksadvising the building owners on any interim steps they should take to mitigate the fire risk until remediation works are completed; andundertaking remediation work.What is the Register of Suppliers?  Often building owners are not quite sure where to get help on a technical building issue such as cladding. Owners may be not sure of the qualifications and skills needed to undertake cladding work. This Register will be an open, publicly available list hosted on the Major Projects Canberra website, which details suppliers who have the qualifications, experience, licences and insurance to undertake cladding work in the ACT.  We are seeking applications from people who are qualified, insured and licensed to work on cladding rectification projects in the ACT as:ArchitectsBuildersBuilding Surveyors/CertifiersFire EngineersProject ManagersQuantity Surveyors, andStructural and/or Façade EngineersThis Register will be publicly available and may be accessed by building owners such as:individuals who are owners of private buildingsowners corporationsowners of commercial buildings.The services required from suppliers will vary for different projects but would be likely to include site inspection, assessment of fire safety risk, engineering and architectural design advice and documentation services, building certification advice and cost estimation,get advice on mitigation options that can be put in place immediately to reduce the risk, while they waiting to remediate the cladding; and undertake remediation work to remove the cladding.The Register is not a procurement panel for Government work and it will not lead to a request for work from the Government.Please go to Information for Suppliers - Major Projects Canberra (act.gov.au)  for further information and to apply for inclusion on the Register of Suppliers.No submissions should be made to TendersACT or a tender box on this TendersACT site.
title: ACT Cladding Program

description: This ATM seeks to identify a suitably qualified contractor who can deliver the provision of Aids to Navigation (AtoN) Maintenance Services in North Queensland (Region 1). AMSA is responsible for providing an effective system of marine AtoN to the commercial shipping industry that meets the standards set by the International Association of Marine Aids to Navigation and Lighthouse Authorities (IALA). The AtoN Network administered by AMSA consists of about 480 aids to navigation located at about 360 sites around Australia’s coastline which assist mariners to make safe and efficient passages. The AtoN (and associated equipment) comprise a variety of structures and systems across the AtoN network that are required to be maintained throughout their useful life. AMSA will maintain the AtoN Network through nine (9) separate contracts (all to be tendered through AusTender), including regional essential maintenance contracts and a centralised technical support and logistics contract. The scope of this AtoN Maintenance Services contract requires the Contractor to undertake planned essential preventative maintenance activities and to provide AtoN fault and failure response services.
title: AtoN Maintenance Services -North QLD- Region 1

description: This request for expressions of interest seeks responses from organisations interested in providing services to support implementation of the Cable Connectivity and Resilience Centre (the Centre). Undersea telecommunications cables are key to global economic growth and resilience. Continued growth in bandwidth demand is likely to drive further cable construction globally and in the Indo-Pacific. However, undersea cables are vulnerable to a variety of risks which can result in serious economic and security consequences. It is crucial that the Indo?Pacific region develops and manages an undersea cable network that is resilient to challenges and supports future economic growth. The Australian Government has established the Centre in DFAT to address the most important issues facing the development and management of undersea cables in the Indo-Pacific. Australia can play a more active role in supporting partner governments’ policy and regulatory development and reforms, shaping regional and global norms, as well as strengthening engagement between the public and private sector on new cable projects. To be effective, the Centre will need to work with a wide range of partners in Indo-Pacific governments, the private sector, regional and multilateral organisations, academia and think tanks, and across the Australian Government. The Centre will contribute to the Quad Partnership for Cable Connectivity and Resilience announced in 2023. The Centre aims to position Australia as a trusted partner for countries in the Indo-Pacific (South and Southeast Asia and the Pacific). DFAT’s early outreach has identified a clear need for assistance regarding undersea cable issues, particularly in Southeast Asia. The Centre will build on and work with existing Australian Government mechanisms for infrastructure funding and advice, including the Australian Infrastructure Financing Facility for the Pacific and the Partnerships for Infrastructure (P4I) program in Southeast Asia. The Centre will be flexible on how and when it works with partners and when it will work independently.
title: Cable Connectivity and Resilience Centre

description: A substantial body of work related to the services and structural reform agenda is ongoing within APEC, with strong support from Austrlia. APEC has advanced structural reform in the region incrementally over many years by sharing economies' experiences, identifying good practices and providing capacity building. APEC brings officials, business, regulatory experts and academics together to discuss relevant issues. Two of the main avenues to promote services rform in APEC are the Group on Services (GOS), which repots to the Committee on Trade and Investment (CTI), and the Economic Committee (EC). In recent years, APEC Ministers have called for a stepping up of work on structural reform in services sectors. This project seeks to respond to that call by adding value to the work already under wya. It operates under the auspices of the EC and the GOS. The project aims to deliver three  outcomes by its completion in July 2026: 1. Unilateral, market opening economic and regulatory reforms in services sectors are increasinly prioritised by APEC economies (Reform) 2. Trade in services are increasinly on the agenda of the EC and other relevant APEC forums, including by linking the structural reform (EAASR) and services competitiveness (ASCR) agendas (Collaboration) 3. APEC developing economies have strengthened capacity to implement reform, through increased knowledge of what works, what doesn't, and what might be possible (Capacity).
title: Australia APEC Services and Structural Reform

description: The National Parks and Wildlife Service (NPWS) is seeking expressions of interest for the lease of the Fitzroy Falls Café premises within Morton National Park.  The premises are within the award-winning Fitzroy Falls Visitor Centre which is located a short walk from the magnificent 80m high Fitzroy Falls. Visitors to this well-known attraction in the Southern Highlands enjoy stunning views of the falls, cliffs and plateaus just 150m from the Visitor Centre. Opportunities for bird watching, hiking and other recreational activities abound.  Suitable qualified operators are invited to submit a proposal for the operation of the premises that focus on the provision of quality visitor services and experiences, and the promotion of the environmental and cultural conservation values of the site.  Interested parties will have extensive experience in operating and managing a food and beverage or events business. NPWS is looking for skills in marketing and an ability to work collaboratively with NPWS in the ongoing conservation and maintenance of the site. All proposals should give consideration to the environmental, cultural and heritage conservation values of the site.  For further information and to apply for this opportunity, please contact commercial.enquiries@environment.nsw.gov.au .

title: Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water / EOI for Lease of Fitzroy Falls café, Morton National Park - EOI-11819A

description:
Minnamurra Rainforest Centre is located at the gateway to the network of stunning elevated walkways through rare remnant rainforest that once reached throughout the Illawarra.  NPWS is seeking proposals from interested parties for the lease and operation of the Centre as a café, function and event space. Some areas may be shared with the NPWS operated visitor information and retail shop.
In 2020 the Centre was part of the multi-million dollar project to reinvigorate visitor facilities within the Minnamurra Rainforest Precinct. The renewal of the Centre included:
• a new commercial kitchen area
• a new deck and viewing platform, creating vantage points for magnificent views of the rainforest
• new internal toilets and newly refurbished external toilets on the ground floor
• increased and improved storage options
• establishment of a flexible, open plan layout that can be used for events and functions
• new audio-visual equipment
• increased accessibility in line with disability access standards
The project also included upgrades of the Rainforest Loop and The Falls walking tracks and viewing platforms.
 For further information and to apply for this opportunity, please contact commercial.enquiries@environment.nsw.gov.au .

	Refer to Additional Details / Instructions
title: Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water / EOI for Lease of Minnamurra Rainforest Centre, Budderoo National Park - EOI-24324A

description:
The NSW Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water (the department) established the Biodiversity Credits Supply Fund (the Supply Fund) to accelerate the supply of biodiversity credits available to meet demand from major projects and infrastructure development. The Supply Fund is operated by the Credits Supply Taskforce (the Taskforce) as part of the department. Through the Supply Fund, the Taskforce is conducting a reverse auction to purchase credits through a competitive process.
 
Credits purchased through the Supply Fund will be re-sold to public or private proponents to meet their offset obligations or to other credit buyers seeking to buy credits for philanthropic or strategic purposes. Proceeds from the sale of the credits will be re-invested in the purchase of more credits to provide long-term investment in biodiversity and credit supply.
 
This reverse auction is seeking credits for which there is anticipated demand in the next six (6) months and provides an opportunity for owners of these credits and prospective owners of these credits to submit a bid to sell them to the Taskforce. Accepted Bids will be selected through a competitive process.
region: Location  NSW Regions: Far North Coast
title: Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water / Biodiversity Credits Supply Fund – 5th Reverse auction for in-demand credits - SR4057427954 RA5

description:
The Advanced Manufacturing Research Facility (AMRF) will be Australia’s first industry-focused manufacturing development facility with a singular mission to accelerate the adoption of advanced technology in manufacturing. Key to a facility of this style and magnitude are the supporting items required to maintain safe and productive working habits. These items will constitute a large range of categories, and the WPCA is actively seeking expressions of interests from suppliers interested in being evaluated for inclusion on a Workshop Equipment and Consumable Procurement Panel for the AMRF.
The attached tender documents describe the services required and set out the conditions of tendering. Your proposal must be lodged prior to the closing time, of Tuesday 12th March 2024 at 5:00pm AEDT. Any tenders submitted after the close of tenders will be assessed as a late tender.
You should note that Western Parkland City Authority may issue an addendum to the invitation documents prior to the close of tenders.
It is your firm’s responsibility to ensure that it submits and lodges a compliant tender response.  Should you require any clarification on any aspect of the invitation documents or tender process, you should contact Western Parkland City Authority Procurement at Procurement@WPCA.sydney  We are unable due to issues of probity to discuss these issues with you verbally.
Confidentiality: You should note that any individual(s) proposed as a resource in you firm’s proposal must complete and sign the Confidentiality Deed Poll (provided as a Word document) and this duly executed document must be lodged as part of your submission.
Code of Ethics and Conduct: A copy of the Authority’s Code of Ethics and Conduct for Procurement activities is included as part of the tender documents.  It is a contractual responsibility placed on all Suppliers to provide a copy of this document to any individual engaged in delivering the Services.  A central issue in the Authority’s code of conduct is the mitigation of any actual, perceived, or potential conflict of interests which may arise when a person engaged in delivering the Services is confronted with issues that that cause a conflict between that person’s public duties and their personal or private interests.  It is incumbent upon any individual engaged on any Western Parkland City Authority contract to disclose to the Authority any conflicts of interest as soon as practicable after the situation reasonably comes to their attention.  Any and all such conflicts of interests must be advised to Western Parkland City Authority (Procurement@WPCA.sydney)
Western Parkland City Authority looks forward to reviewing your firm’s proposal.
title: Bundle 24 Workshop Equipment and Consumables Panel for the AMRF - WPCA-AMRF-23-047

description: Stanwell Corporation Limited (Stanwell) is inviting Tenders for Valve Maintenance Services onsite at Stanwell's power generating sites at Stanwell Power Station and Tarong Power Stations.  Please Note: Stanwell uses the Zycus Supplier Network (ZSN) portal to conduct Tenders and Expressions of Interest and only uses QTenders to advertise. There are no documents to download from or upload to, QTenders. You cannot submit a Tender or Expression of Interest to Stanwell in QTenders. To access the Request for Tender/Expression of Interest on the Zycus Supplier Network (ZSN) portal, please copy and paste the following link into your browser: https://zsn.zycus.com/guest/genericRegister/STA176/iSource/222025/  Browser Compatibility – The Zycus Supplier Network (ZSN) portal is compatible with up-to-date versions of Microsoft Edge, Apple Safari, Firefox and Google Chrome. Superseded versions of Internet Explorer are not compatible. Registered Users: Login using the left-hand side of the screen with your registered email and password. If you see a message that your profile is incomplete, please click on ‘Complete profile’, then complete and submit. If you do not complete the profile you will not be approved to access the Request for Tender/Expression of Interest. If you have forgotten your password, click on ‘forgot password’ and you will be sent an email with a code to help you login. If you are uncertain of your registration status, please email Stanwell’s support at iBUY@stanwell.com for guidance. New Users: If you are a new user, please register on the right-hand side of the screen. Insert the email you will use for tenders, create a password and click ‘Register’. After registering you will receive an email with a 5 digit “one time password” (OTP). Copy and paste the OTP into the’ Welcome to ZSN page’ and click ‘Verify OTP’ (note that the OTP must be entered within 30 seconds). Entering this code activates your registration. Once you have registered, you need to complete your company profile and submit for approval by Stanwell. You will then receive an email confirming you are approved. Please do not click on ‘I will do this later’ as you will not be approved to access the Request for Tender/Expression of Interest until your profile is submitted and approved. Once approved, you will then be able to access the Request for Tender/Expression of Interest. Need Help? If you have questions, need support registering on the ZSN, or accessing the Request for Tender / EOI, please email Stanwell support at iBuy@stanwell.com (do not reply to emails from admin@zycus.com).
title: Valve Maintenance Services (on-site) for Stanwell Corporation Limited

agency: Issued by Queensland Police Service
description: The Queensland Government is seeking Proposals for the Provision of Roster Advisory Service The QPS has initiated a project to review, develop and implement improved rostering capability across the organisation and is seeking consultancy services to advise and assist the QPS Roster Steering Committee and Project Members to analyse, develop and implement improved rostering and associated practices.  The scope of the committee and project at this time is “Frontline District Demand” which covers all QPS 15 districts and includes but not limited members from the following Capabilities; general duties, investigators and road policing.  It is expected that the supplier will determine operational demand for both trial sites and in doing so determine a ‘tool’ for generic use by subsequent Districts to provide some organisational consistency in determining frontline demand patterns.This engagement will supplement the work undertaken by the “Rostering Project” by undertaking an assessment of existing QPS operational rostering practices and identify limitations and areas of improvement. The assessment will take into consideration existing legislation, policy and process around QPS industrial measures, Enterprise Bargaining Agreements (EBA) and fatigue management practices and guidelines.  It is expected that a final deliverable will provide a set of alternate roster and work hour arrangements considering the operational requirements (rostering to community demand), employee preferences, strategic considerations, flexibility to adapt to disruption. The specific organisational scope of this engagement will be for two (of the organisational wide 15) districts.  These two districts will be used as ‘trial sites’ for improving QPS rostering capability and using the findings and lessons to inform and plan repeatable implementation in the remaining QPS districts.  For detailed information on the specific goods / services sought under this tender, please review the "Specification " in "Attachment A within this RFQ".
title: RFQ: Provision of Roster Advisory Service

description: This Request for Expression of Interest (Request) is for the provision of Municipal Services (the Services) to Aboriginal Peoples and their communities (Aboriginal Communities) in the Kimberley region. The Services are to be provided in four Zones as follows: Zone 1: West Kimberley (25 Aboriginal Communities); Zone 2: East Kimberley (20 Aboriginal Communities); Zone 3: Gibb River (7 Aboriginal Communities); and Zone 4: Dampier Peninsula & Outstations (25 AboriginalCommunites). Contracts for these Zones may be issued for up to five years,comprising a three year period with two discretionary one-year extension options. The Services for each Zone comprise repair and maintenance services to municipal infrastructure, as follows: Roads Maintenance (sealed & unsealed within the Communities); Rubbish Collection; Landfill; Public Area Management; Stormwater Drainage Management; Shrub and Vegetation Control; Firebreak Management; and Airstrip Maintenance This Request is the first part of a two-stage procurement process. For this stage, businesses, contractors and organisations including those that are Aboriginal owned, community-controlled or led, are invited to lodge a submission (Response) for one or more Zones. Responses will be assessed for shortlisting into the second stage of the procurement process, which is a Request for Tender (RFT). Up to five Respondents may be shortlisted for the RFT for each Zone. You must submit a Response for this Request to be considered for shortlisting in the RFT stage. Briefing session Details Location: Level 1, 5 Newman Court Fremantle WA 6160 Date and Time: 10.30am Monday 11 March 2024 Site Visit: No Contact Person: Silvana Abbruzzese Addition Information: Please contact ahsplanningprocurement@communities.wa.gov.au to express your interest in attending the Briefing Session Refer to the Request for the details of regional briefing sessions Online Event Registration Meeting ID: 412 747 020 124 Passcode: TuWVRv
title: Provision of Municipal Services to Remote Aboriginal Peoples and their Communities in the Kimberley RegionIssued by Department of Communities

description: Spatial WA is a program of work proposing the delivery of a whole of government Advanced Spatial Digital Twin (ASDT) comprising of: Next Generation Spatial Cadastre (NGSC) which will provide the technology to uplift the States current 2D spatial cadastre to maintain property rights, restrictions, and responsibilities in 3D/4D across Government. A Spatial Digital Twin (SDT) platform, which will provide a digital, spatially accurate representation of the built and natural environment, with the capability to share, discover, visualise and analyse data about a specific place, at a specific time. The ASDT will be enabled through a framework for data modernisation that will support agencies in uplifting their data, aligned to the 3D/4D spatial cadastre, with appropriate governance. Developed in consultation with over 30 agencies (including government trading enterprises), the ASDT will provide the digital capability to share, discover and visualise the State?s data, with advanced capabilities for analytics, predictive modelling, and digital workflows. Landgate will lead Program delivery and work closely with partner agencies. The initial five years of the program (Horizon One) focuses on implementation NGSC and SDT demonstrating the outcomes required through four priority use cases along with data modernisation. Following this, the ASDT will be upscaled for broader use in the public and private sectors.
title: Spatial WA Advanced Spatial Digital Twin PlatformsIssued by Landgate
